str2: Wherefore (emphatically), for which very reason. From dio and per; on which very account.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Food of any kind. From the base of bibrosko; food, especially articles allowed or forbidden by the Jewish law.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From skandalon; to entrap, i.e. Trip up (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular

str2: Flesh; plur: pieces of flesh, kinds of flesh. Perhaps a primary word; meat.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From skandalon; to entrap, i.e. Trip up (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure).
